Entry.Name: Insecure Socket
Entry.Description: Using 'SSLCertificateSocketFactory.createSocket()' without parameters or with an 'InetAddress' as the first parameter does not perform hostname verification by default, leaving these sockets susceptible to Man-in-the-Middle (MitM) attacks.

Mitigation.Textual:
Class SSLCertificateSocketFactory was deprecated in API level 29. If application use this class as described previously, it is imperative to verify the server's identity manually after establishing the socket connection.
It's recommended to use use less error-prone alternatives provided by standard APIs for creating SSLSocket instances and verifying hostnames, like SSLSocketFactory#getDefault() or SSLContext.getSocketFactory().
Further information at this link.
